intro: Galium requienianum, commonly known as the pink and white woodsorrel, is a herbaceous perennial plant native to parts of Europe and Asia. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its opposite, simple, ovate leaves and clusters of small, fragrant flowers. The flowers typically have five petals, with the upper one being pink and the lower ones white, giving it its common name. It thrives in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. The plant produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain several seeds, facilitating its propagation in suitable habitats.
